example.eg: I'm leaving now.  Are you going to come with me or not?
example.egtrans: 我要走了，你要跟我一起吗？

example.eg: Does the hamburger come with fries?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…一起, 配有，与…搭配

dsense.name: come down with [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (fall ill) (比喻，非正式用语)

example.eg: I've just come down with a cold.
I couldn't believe she came out with that remark.
The company has come out with a new miracle drug.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引入, 把…投入市场销售

example.eg: I'll have to come up with a plan.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 设计出，发明出, 想出

example.eg: Will you be able to come up with the cash by the end of the month?
example.egtrans: 你能在月底交付那笔现金吗？

example.eg: I knew that at some point, I would have to come face to face with my ex.

dsense.name: come in contact with [sth], come into contact with [sth]

example.eg: I phoned the doctor as soon as I found out I had come in contact with someone who had Swine Flu.

dsense.name: come in contact with [sb], come into contact with [sb]

example.eg: It was a long hard battle but we finally came to an agreement with each other.
I came to an agreement with my ex-wife that I would watch the kids on the weekends.

dsense.name: come to grips with [sth], get to grips with [sth]

example.eg: One must read a work of philosophy several times in order to come to grips with it.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 了解, 明白, 懂得

dsense.name: come to grips with [sth], get to grips with [sth]

example.eg: When I had finally come to grips with algebra, I began to learn calculus.

dsense.name: come to grips with [sth], get to grips with [sth]

example.eg: It was difficult to come to grips with my parents' tragic deaths.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处理, 应付, 接受

example.eg: It took Rich years to come to terms with the death of his father.
